title: The Block's teams reveal their weight loss
text:
The Block is one of the most grueling shows around, with contestants having to keep up both mentally and physically with the workload.

And now the contestants have revealed just how demanding filming was and the toll it took on their bodies, with many of them losing weight.

Speaking to WHO magazine, Mel confessed she would sometimes be so busy she'd forget to eat, while Luke and Mark revealed they'd lost 5kg and 9kg respectively.

Scroll down for video

'My body definitely changed': The stars of The Block, including Tess and Luke (pictured), have stripped off for a WHO magazine photo shoot

'My body definitely changed,' Tess said.

'I remember during the middle and end of The Block, I saw photos from when I started, and my face, arms and legs had definitely changed.'

She explained that her weight loss was due to the 'scaffold and stress'.

Too busy to eat! Mel said she forgot to eat a balanced diet because the stress of renovating the St Kilda townhouses was overwhelming. Pictured with her partner Jesse

Stripping off: Matt (pictured with wife El'ise) said he had 'dropped a lot of kilos' during filming

Mel explained that she forgot to eat a balanced diet because the stress of renovating the St Kilda townhouses was overwhelming.

'At the start of the week I would eat, but towards the end - from Friday to Sunday - there were times I wouldn't eat anything for a whole day,' she said.

Andy and Deb, meanwhile, said they had lost 10kg and 5kg respectively.

Looking good, lads! Mitch and Mark, who lost 9kg on the show, posed in their budgy smugglers

Slimming down! Andy and Deb, meanwhile, said they had lost 10kg and 5kg respectively

It comes after Tess and Luke revealed on The Block this week that they had completely blown their budget.

The pair are struggling to complete their studio, which could result in them being eliminated from the competition before auction day.

'We're in not a great position at the moment, we got a few weeks left to go and we've got really, no money,' Tess said.
